intro: Jupunba alexandri, commonly known as the Alexandrian jupunba, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Jupunba alexandri is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine by local communities.
